content.description: Sit start laying back on the flake on the left side of the overhanging face on the far right end of the cliff. From the start lay back to gain a decent crimp and move out right to the flake and pull over the top.
content.location: Start about 6-8 feet right of the problem No Preservatives. This is roughly in the center of the Golden Wall.

content.description: Stand start on two head high compression moves and high feet, and move straight up into the flared crack and top out. This starts on the same holds as Standard Fare but climbs straight up instead of traversing right.
content.location: Start a couple feet left of No Preservatives, just left of the large pine tree on two opposing, vertical crimps.

content.description: Stand start on two head high compression moves and high feet, move out left to the gaston, and get high feet. Stand on some questionable feet to get to a decent-ish crimp, then get up to the slopey jug, and pull over the lip. (The big rails with lots of lichen out to the left are off.)
content.protection: One pad should be fine, two is plenty.
content.location: Start a couple feet left of No Preservatives.

content.description: Stand start the 25 foot, dicey slab. You start just left of the detached flake. Climb straight up the slab and faint left arête to a highball top out.
content.location: On the left end of the Golden Wall, this problem begins just left of a small, detached block.

content.description: Sit start the undercut wall using the crack/seam.
content.location: It is located roughly in the center of the Golden Wall.

content.description: Start in the middle of the wall that Stage Fright is on, and after getting your feet on the biggest crescent divot, move right to some good feet, and then go straight up to a sketchy topout.
content.protection: After moving off of the big crescent, the sharp boulder makes pads mostly irrelevant.

content.description: Stand start at the center of the Golden Wall, and move straight up through the crescent features and technical smearing to a big crimp at ~15-20 feet. From there, move up through a ladder of easy crimps. The top is much easier than the bottom but shouldn't be taken lightly due to the height.
content.location: Start in the middle of the Golden Wall, and finish ~25 feet straight up.

content.description: Stand start just to the right of the flake on the left side of the Golden Wall, make your way almost straight up, cutting right to get your right foot on the leftmost crescent feature. From here, move through some small hands and bad feet to the good crimp rail, and top out straight up.
content.protection: A pad and an active spotter. The landing on the pad may be difficult if you slip.
content.location: On the leftmost side of the Golden Wall, there is a small flake (~2 foot tall) that stands straight up. Start standing just to the right of the flake. This climb goes straight through the large bulge on the Golden Wall.

content.description: Sit start on crimps, and move up the steep face to the slopey nose and a hard and sketchy topout.
content.location: It is in a small alcove at the far left end of the Golden Wall.

content.description: Climb the wall on somewhat frayed crimps.
content.location: Start about 6-8 feet right of the problem Up for Parole.

content.description: Stand start the sheer face, and move straight up on crimps and sparse feet. This problem was an open project and was tried by many in the past.
content.location: This ascends the hidden orange wall near the Boxcar Boulders.

content.description: This is a long, golden wall built into the hillside with some decent problems. The wall faces the pond.
